basics.name: Duaa Nakshbandi
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Passionate and persistent Software Engineer with a Bachelor of Science degree in Software Engineering and Management from the Technical University of Graz. Strong interest in mathematics, particularly in the mathematical foundations of computer science. Experience in research and project contributions across Europe and the USA.

work.name: Siemens AG - Research Group T SSP SRA-AT
work.summary: Contributed to the development of the Industrial Information Hub (IIH) product, collaborating across teams in the USA, China, India, Germany, and Austria. Designed and implemented a schema-matching algorithm for OPC UA schemas on the IIH aggregation server. Worked on the GraphQL API for the Production Data Model (PDM) core service, transforming OPC UA-based ontologies into a GraphQL object API with advanced filtering capabilities. Deployed multiple IIH applications on AWS using Kubernetes, with Helm charts to manage deployments. Created integration tests for a gRPC OPC connector service in C++ using the GTest framework. Developed and maintained various HTTP endpoints for the IIH core server using C# and .NET
highlights: Technologies: C#, Node.js, C++, Python, Kubernetes, REST APIs, VMware, Workstation, Gitlab, Helm, GraphQL

work.name: University of Vienna
work.summary: Assisted in coordinating the RAQMYAT Erasmus+ project with the University of Vienna and Unione delle Università del Mediterraneo (UNIMED), supporting the digital transformation of seven Tunisian universities. Organized the RAQMYAT Summer School in Vienna in 2024. Worked closely with University of Vienna’s Project Lead, Lucas Zinner, and Project Team Member, Angela Meyer.

work.name: Institute of Interactive Systems and Data Science, Graz University of Technology
work.position: Undergraduate Lab and Teaching Assistant for Human-Computer-Interaction
work.summary: Worked as a Teaching Assistant (TA) for the course  Human-Computer-Interaction ”, taught by Ao.Univ.-Prof. Dipl.-Ing. Dr.techn Keith Andrews, at the Institute of Interactive Systems and Data Science.
highlights: Maintained and contributed to the Sapphire course management system, an open-source platform used for managing HCI courses at Graz University of Technology.
Contributions were acknowledged in Prof. Keith Andrews' paper presented at INTERACT 2023, which discusses strategies for teaching HCI to large undergraduate classes.
Conducted assignment interviews with students and corrected submissions
Performed plagiarism checks and maintained the course website.

work.name: Institute of Software Technology, Graz University of Technology
work.position: Undergraduate Lab and Teaching Assistant for Object-Oriented Analysis and Design
work.summary: Worked as a Teaching Assistant (TA) for the course  Object-Oriented Analysis and Design”, taught by Univ.-Prof. Dipl.-Ing. Dr.techn. Alexander Felfernig , M.Sc. Man Le Viet, and Dr.techn. B.Sc. M.Sc. Trang Tran, at the Institute of Software Technology.
highlights: Taught second-year students concepts including: Object Orientation, Object-Relational Mapping, Software Design Principles, Design Patterns, Requirements Engineering, UML Diagrams, Automated Testing.
Organized workshops and coding labs.
Conducted assignment interviews with students and corrected submissions.
Assisted students in understanding course material and answered their questions.

work.name: Institute of Interactive Systems and Data Science, Graz University of Technology
work.position: Undergraduate Lab and Teaching Assistant for Project Management
work.summary: Worked as a Teaching Assistant (TA) for the course “Project Management”, taught by As-soc.Prof. Dipl.-Ing. Dr.techn. Christian Gütl and Mag.rer.nat. Alexander Steinmaurer, at the Institute of Interactive Systems and Data Science.
highlights: Guided students over two semesters in developing and managing software projects to create functioning prototypes.
Conducted workshops on prototype creation.
Taught requirement analysis, business plan creation, and software project management fundamentals.

volunteer.location: Microsoft, Denver Tech Center, Colorado, USA
volunteer.summary: Collaborated with Jerry Nixon, Senior Software Engineer at Microsoft, and Daren May, Director of Software Development at Kahua, in organizing Denver Dev Day 2023, Colorado's premier software summit.
highlights: Collected and analyzed visitor surveys, providing a comprehensive data set to understand attendee feedback.
Managed speaker logistics and communication as the speaker coordinator.

volunteer.organization: Education Directorate of Styria and University of Graz
volunteer.summary: Mentored high school students over two semesters in developing their pre-scientific papers and diploma theses.
highlights: Provided guidance on various aspects of academic writing, including: literature research, citation styles, paper structure, effective writing techniques.
Drew upon academic experience to offer valuable insights.
Assisted students in achieving their academic goals through personalized mentorship.

volunteer.summary: Referee for Rescue Maze at the 16th RoboCupJunior Austrian Open 2024.
highlights: Monitored and evaluated the performance of high school students' autonomous robots in the maze run field.

volunteer.summary: Volunteered at the WeAreDevelopers World Congress in 2023, Europe’s largest Software Engineering and Development event.
highlights: Coordinated speakers and ensured the smooth execution of the program.
Gained valuable experience in volunteer coordination and event management.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

references.name: Dr. Angela Meyer, Research Services, University of Vienna
references.reference: Duaa Nakshbandi is a delight to work with. She is not only a very reliable, proactive and dedicated person, but also forward thinking and does not need many instructions to know what to do. Her excellent knowledge of English, German and Arabic and her exemplary interpersonal and organisational skills enabled the discharge of her assignments with maximum efficiency...

references.name: Prof. Dr. Keith Andrews, Institute of Interactive Systems and Data Science, Thechnical University of Graz
references.reference: While studying at Graz University of Technology, Duaa Nakshbandi worked as a tutor twice for my course “Human-Computer Interaction” (Summer Semester 2023 and 2024). Duaa was a valuable member of my teaching team. She was committed and motivated and demonstrated both organisational flair and technical competence. In addition, Duaa wrote her Bachelor’s Thesis under my supervision. She worked dilligently and thoroughly and produced some excellent results.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Quantum Teleportation
Quantum Cryptography
